text: Ahmed Eissa Elmohamady Abdel Fattah (; born 9 September 1987) is an Egyptian former professional footballer who played as a right-back and captained the Egypt national football team. He was part of the Egyptian squads that won the 2008 and 2010 Africa Cup of Nations. ==Career statistics== Appearances and goals by club, season and competition Club Season League National Cup League Cup Europe Other Total Division Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Ghazl El Mahalla 2004–05 Egyptian Premier League 14 4 ?? ?? — — — 14 4 2005–06 Egyptian Premier League 3 0 ?? ?? — — — 3 0 Total 17 4 ?? ?? 0 0 0 0 0 0 17 4 ENPPI 2006–07 Egyptian Premier League 12 2 ?? ?? — — — 12 2 2007–08 Egyptian Premier League 6 1 ?? ?? — — — 6 1 2008–09 Egyptian Premier League 28 6 ?? ?? — — — 28 6 2009–10 Egyptian Premier League 26 3 ?? ?? — — — 26 3 Total 72 12 ?? ?? 0 0 0 0 0 0 72 12 Sunderland 2010–11 Premier League 36 0 1 0 1 0 — — 38 0 2011–12 Premier League 18 1 2 0 1 0 — — 21 1 2012–13 Premier League 2 0 0 0 0 0 — — 2 0 Total 56 1 3 0 2 0 0 0 0 0 61 1 Hull City 2012–13 Championship 41 3 0 0 0 0 — — 41 3 2013–14 Premier League 38 2 6 0 1 0 — — 45 2 2014–15 Premier League 38 2 1 0 0 0 4Appearances in the Europa League 1 — 43 3 2015–16 Championship 41 3 3 0 4 0 — 3Appearances in Championship play-offs 0 51 3 2016–17 Premier League 33 0 0 0 4 0 — — 37 0 Total 191 10 10 0 9 0 4 1 3 0 217 11 Aston Villa 2017–18 Championship 43 0 0 0 0 0 — 2 0 45 0 2018–19 Championship 38 2 0 0 1 0 — 3 0 42 2 2019–20 Premier League 18 1 1 0 6 1 — — 25 2 2020–21 Premier League 14 0 0 0 3 0 — — 17 0 Total 113 3 1 0 10 1 0 0 5 0 129 4 Career total 449 30 14 0 21 1 4 1 8 0 496 32 ===International=== Appearances and goals by national team and year National team Year Apps Goals Egypt 2007 5 0 2008 14 0 2009 12 0 2010 12 1 2011 3 0 2012 13 1 2013 6 0 2014 5 0 2015 1 0 2016 1 0 2017 8 0 2018 7 1 2019 5 3 Total 92 6 ===International goals=== :Egypt score listed first, score column indicates score after each Elmohamady goal.
